intro: Orchis ustulata subsp. aestivalis, commonly known as the early marsh orchid, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to wetland and marsh habitats in Europe. It typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring a single, erect stem with alternate, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces a spike of pale yellow to greenish-yellow flowers, which bloom from April to June. Its roots are fibrous and adapted to thrive in waterlogged soils. This subspecies is distinguished by its earlier flowering time compared to other members of the Orchis genus.
